import React from 'react'; import { Box, Typography, Grid, Paper } from '@mui/material'; const Home = () => { return ( {/* Main Title */} Welcome to the Home Page {/* RBAC Information Section */} What is RBAC (Role-Based Access Control)? Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) is a method of restricting system access to authorized users. It is widely used by organizations to ensure that employees or users only have access to the data and systems that are relevant to their roles within the organization. In RBAC, users are assigned roles, and roles are granted specific permissions. {/* Example Image Section */} {/* More Detailed Explanation */} RBAC Structure: In RBAC, users are assigned roles, which in turn are associated with permissions to perform certain actions on resources. Here's a breakdown of the typical structure:
  • User: A person or entity that needs access to a system.
  • Role: A set of permissions defining what actions a user can perform.
  • Permission: An action that a user can perform, such as reading or writing data.
{/* Conclusion */} RBAC is a powerful way to manage access and ensures that users only have the permissions they need. It's especially useful in large organizations where managing individual permissions for each user can become complex. ); }; export default Home;
